result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus A Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus A Hinton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Deb at P & P - defendant has paid in full
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (07/21/2017)

1:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Bret Grant present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding payment of monies.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if he does not have this paid off in the one year, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.

Court adjourned at 1:03 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
9:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to the charge.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs.
Domestic abuse assessment and any follow-up.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court will allow early termination of probation after 6 months if all conditions are completed.
Defendant to submit to a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:47 a.m.

9:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests to talk with the District Attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 21, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:43 a.m.
No Violent Contact with Jennifer S.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
No Violent Contact with Jennifer S.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:54 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Jennifer S.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 9:30 a.m..

Court adjourned at 1:56 p.m.
